1.brief: morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
a (sudden) alarm (properly, the object feared, by implication, the feeling)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

2.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to be smooth (figuratively); by implication (as smooth stones were used for lots) to apportion or separate
near, with or among; often in general, to
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present

3.brief: a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
properly, to be flabby, i.e. (by implication) desist; (figuratively) be lacking or idle
to be (causatively, make or act) circumspect and hence, intelligent
to be (causative) make well, literally (sound, beautiful) or figuratively (happy, successful, right)

4.brief: strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol

properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a bed (figuratively, a bier); abstractly, sleep; by euphemism, carnal intercourse
to place (any thing so as to stay); reflexively, to station, offer, continue
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

5.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
literally firmness; figuratively security; morally fidelity
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
a powder (as beaten small); by analogy, a thin vapor; by extension, the firmament

6.brief: rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
an abyss (as a surging mass of water), especially the deep (the main sea or the subterranean watersupply)
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
properly, a dumb beast; especially any large quadruped or animal (often collective)
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

7.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
an edge or extremity; specifically (of a bird or army) a wing, (of a garment or bedclothing) a flap, (of the earth) a quarter, (of a building) a pinnacle
to flee for protection; figuratively, to confide in

8.brief: to slake the thirst (occasionally of other appetites)
the fat; abstractly fatness, i.e. (figuratively) abundance; specifically the (fatty) ashes of sacrifices
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
a stream, especially a winter torrent; (by implication) a (narrow) valley (in which a brook runs); also a shaft (of a mine)
to quaff, i.e. (causatively) to irrigate or furnish apotion to

9.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
properly, something dug, i.e. a (general) source (of water, even when naturally flowing; also of tears, blood (by euphemism, of the female pudenda); figuratively, of happiness, wisdom, progeny)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)

10.brief: to draw, used in a great variety of applications (including to sow, to sound, to prolong, to develop, to march, to remove, to delay, to be tall, etc.)
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

11.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda
arrogance or majesty; by implication, (concretely) ornament
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to nod, i.e. waver; figuratively, to wander, flee, disappear; also (from shaking the head in sympathy), to console, deplore, or (from tossing the head in scorn) taunt

12.brief: there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be able, literally (can, could) or morally (may, might)
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)

13.brief: there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be able, literally (can, could) or morally (may, might)
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
